examples: manual labor (= work using your hands)
The price will include the labor and materials.
The company wants to keep down labor costs.
The workers voted to withdraw their labor (= to stop work as a means of protest).
a fair division of labor between men and women

meanings.def: a task or period of work
examples: He was so exhausted from the day's labors that he went straight to bed.
People look forward to enjoying the fruits of their labors during retirement.

meanings.def: the people who work or are available for work in a country or company
examples: child/forced/slave labor
a shortage of labor
Companies are making huge profits by exploiting cheap labor in poor countries.
There is a growing demand for skilled labor.
New labor laws make it more difficult for employers to sack workers.
good labor relations (= the relationship between workers and employers)

meanings.def: the period of time or the process of giving birth to a baby
examples: in labor Jane was in labor for ten hours.
She went into labor early.
labor pains
It was a difficult labor.

meanings.def: a hard task that you do because you want to, not because it is necessary
examples: Writing the book was a labor of love.

idioms.def: a hard task that you do because you want to, not because it is necessary
examples: Writing the book was a labor of love.

meanings.def: to try very hard to do something difficult
examples: labor (away) He was in his study laboring away over some old papers.
labor to do something They labored for years to clear their son's name.
We labored all day in the fields.
(old-fashioned) the laboring classes (= the working class)

meanings.def: to move with difficulty and effort
examples: The horses labored up the steep slope.
With the engine laboring, the car struggled up the hill.

meanings.def: to continue to repeat or explain something that has already been said and understood
examples: I understand what you're saying—there's no need to labor the point.

idioms.def: to continue to repeat or explain something that has already been said and understood
examples: I understand what you're saying—there's no need to labor the point.
